Graph Manager¶

  • Graph Manager

  • Observer Pattern

  • Backend Communication

Graph Manager¶

class src.hippo7_app.hippo7_frontend.graph_manager.GraphManager(target='localhost', port=8000)¶

The GraphManager handles the communication between frontend and backend. It stores the graph and propagates changes to listeners in the frontend as well as the backend.

By default he retrieves a graph from the backend and turns the nodes into Observables and stores them in node_param dictionary.

activate_preset(id: str, status: str)¶

Trigger all changes defined in a preset. :param id: Id of a preset. :param status: “On” / “Off” used for toggle presets.

change_sending()¶

To allow making multiple changes before sending, this can cache changes and send them all at once.

graph_to_str()¶

Print the graph in human readable form. This can be directly used as preset.

map_types_to_nodes()¶

Map the node behaviour to the nodes in the graph.

set(node_name, param_name, value)¶

Propagates changes to the observable node and the backend. :param node_name: Node name (id). :param param_name: The parameter of the node that changed. :param value: The new value for the parameter.

Observer Pattern¶

The observer pattern is a design pattern where a object, maintains a list of its dependents, called observers, and notifies them automatically of any state changes, usually by calling one of their methods.

In this case the values from different nodes in the backend are the subjects and the associated widgets are the observers.

class src.hippo7_app.hippo7_frontend.graph_manager.Observable(name, value, **kwargs)¶

Implements the observer pattern. All subscribes to the object will be notified about changes. Every call of set_value triggers a notify.

Parameters

  • name – Name of the observable.

  • value – Only value that will trigger notify messages. Changes to other values are ignored.

  • **kwargs – Other arguments that will be propagated alongside with name and value.

notify()¶

Notify all subscribed members about an updated value.

set_value(value)¶

Changes local value and triggers notify. Values have to be changed using this method, otherwise notify will not be called.

Parameters

value – The new Value.

subscribe(callback)¶

Subscribe to this node to get notified when the value gets changed.

Parameters

callback – Function that will be called on change, with the updated value as parameter.

Backend Communication¶

In the following class the communication with the backend takes place. The interface mirrors the backend API and provides basic functionality such as sending a updated node and handles first step en- and decoding.

class src.hippo7_app.hippo7_frontend.backend_interface.BackendInterface(address='lex', port=8000, **kwargs)¶

Establish to a server at the given address and port.

connect(address, port)¶

Connect to a server with a given address & port.

get_graph() → dict¶

Request the currently used graph from the backend.

Returns

A decoded graph consisting of nodes.

get_node_behaviours() → dict¶

Request the behaviour for all existing nodes from the backend.

Returns

Dictionary mapping from node to type and behaviour.

set_node_value(node_name, node_dict: dict)¶

Send a message to the backend, with the name and values of a updated node.

Parameters

  • node_name – Name of the modified node.

  • node_dict – Parameter names with values.

src.hippo7_app.hippo7_frontend.backend_interface.json_to_graph(json_str: str) -> (<class 'dict'>, <class 'list'>, <class 'dict'>)¶

Transform a string (json message) containing the backend graph and presets to a graph and presets in frontend format. :param json_str: Backend graph as json string

Returns

Dictionary with all nodes and their inputs, a list of preset names and their toggle behavior and a dict with the actual preset values.
